item.title: Window Maker Live 0.96.0-0 Released
item.description: If you're a fan of the Window Maker window manager, there's a new official release of the Linux distribution that champions the old-school user interface.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: KDE Plasma 6 Sets Release Date
item.description: If you've been anxiously awaiting the release of the next big KDE Plasma milestone, you can rest assured it's sooner than you think.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: Fedora 39 Prepares for Release
item.description: The latest release from the Fedora team is about to be unleashed and it includes plenty to excite users of all types.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: Fedora Project and Slimbook Release the New Fedora Slimbook
item.description: If you're a fan of the Fedora Linux distribution and are in the market for a new Linux laptop, Slimbook might be what you need.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: Gnome Developers in Discussion to End Support for X.Org
item.description: In a move that should surprise no one, the team behind the GNOME desktop environment is hinting at removing support for X.Org so they can focus on Wayland.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: Valve Updates Proton to Greatly Improve Windows Gaming on Linux
item.description: If you're a gamer who uses Linux and Steam, you'll be pleased to know the company has released a new version of Proton which is a big step forward for the platform.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: New Linux Vulnerability Enables a Privilege Escalation
item.description: Looney Tunables is a new Linux vulnerability that has been discovered in the GNU C library that can lead to privilege escalation.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: elementary OS 7.1 Now Available for Download
item.description: The team behind elementary OS has released the latest version of its operating system with a focus on personalization, inclusivity, accessibility, and privacy.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: The GNU Project Celebrates Its 40th Birthday
item.description: September 27 marks the 40th anniversary of the GNU Project, and it was celebrated with a hacker meeting in Biel/Bienne, Switzerland.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: Linux Kernel Reducing Long-Term Support
item.description: LTS support for the Linux kernel is about to undergo some serious changes that will have a considerable impact on the future.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: Fedora 39 Beta Now Available for Testing
item.description: For fans and users of Fedora Linux, the first beta of release 39 is now available, which is a minor upgrade but does include GNOME 45.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: Fedora Linux 40 to Drop X11 for KDE Plasma
item.description: When Fedora 40 arrives in 2024, there will be a few big changes coming, especially for the KDE Plasma option.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: Real-Time Ubuntu Available in AWS Marketplace
item.description: Anyone looking for a Linux distribution for real-time processing could do a whole lot worse than Real-Time Ubuntu.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: KSMBD Finally Reaches a Stable State
item.description: For those who've been looking forward to the first release of KSMBD, after two years it's no longer considered experimental.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: Nitrux 3.0.0 Has Been Released
item.description: The latest version of Nitrux brings plenty of innovation and fresh apps to the table.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: Linux From Scratch 12.0 Now Available
item.description: If you're looking to roll your own Linux distribution, the latest version of Linux From Scratch is now available with plenty of updates.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: Linux Kernel 6.5 Has Been Released
item.description: The newest Linux kernel, version 6.5, now includes initial support for two very exciting features.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: UbuntuDDE 23.04 Now Available
item.description: A new version of the UbuntuDDE remix has finally arrived with all the updates from the Deepin desktop and everything that comes with the Ubuntu 23.04 base.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: Star Labs Reveals a New Surface-Like Linux Tablet
item.description: If you've ever wanted a tablet that rivals the MS Surface, you're in luck as Star Labs has created such a device.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: SUSE Going Private (Again)
item.description: The company behind SUSE Linux Enterprise, Rancher, and NeuVector recently announced that Marcel LUX III SARL (Marcel), its majority shareholder, intends to delist it from the Frankfurt Stock Exchange by way of a merger.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)
